description: Probably from Turkish çavuş. Doublet of chiaus.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) One who is easily cheated; a gullible person.

examples: By this hand of flesh, Would it might never write good court-hand more, If I discover . What do you think of me, That I am a chouse?

verbs.description: chouse (third-person singular simple present chouses, present participle chousing, simple past and past participle choused)

examples: I cannot think otherwise than that the undertaker of the aforecited poesy hath choused your Highness; for I have seen painted, I know not where, the identically same Dian, with full as many nymphs, as he calls them, and more dogs.

verbs.description: chouse (third-person singular simple present chouses, present participle chousing, simple past and past participle choused)

entries.meaning: (US, of cattle) To handle roughly, as by chasing or scaring.
(US, regional) To handle, to take care of.
(transitive, US, regional) To cause undesirable activity in livestock, such as running. [from late 19th c.]
